Class ObjectStack

java.lang.Object
  ObjectStack
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectStackInterface
public class ObjectStack
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectStackInterface

ObjectStack class simulates a stack datatype using Arrays, an arguement an item is passed to the class which then casts it into an array of objects, this gives it the versatility of maintaining multiple datatypes in one array stack.

Version:
Final 3/9/2018
Author:
Eric Davey

Constructor Summary
ObjectStack()
          constructor ObjectStack() initializes item as an Object array and top at -1 to be the starting index of the top of the stack
 
Method Summary
 void clear()
          method clear() initializes item as an Object array[1] and resets top back to the starting position of the bottom of the stack(-1)
 boolean isEmpty()
          method isEmpty() returns a true or false value to indicate whether or not the stack is empty or not, if top contains an integer value or -1 return true, else false.
 boolean isFull()
          method isFull() returns a boolean value if top is equal to the length of the stack-1
 java.lang.Object pop()
          method pop() returns the object placed at the top of the array item[] first the method checks if the stack is empty, if it is then pop has been called incorrectly and it exits the program, else an object temp is created and set equal to the value stored at item indexed at top, and sets item at top to null before decrementing top.
 void push(java.lang.Object o)
          method push() takes in an object o as a parameter, checks if the stack is full by calling isFull(), if it is full the array is resized by calling resize and passing argument 2* the length of the current array.
 java.lang.Object top()
          method top() returns the object stored at the top of the stack, without moving the index or getting rid of the item stored in top.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
method isEmpty() returns a true or false value to indicate whether or not the stack is empty or not, if top contains an integer value or -1 return true, else false.

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface ObjectStackInterface
Returns:
boolean value true or false if top contains an integer value equal to -1.

isFull

public boolean isFull()
method isFull() returns a boolean value if top is equal to the length of the stack-1

Specified by:
isFull in interface ObjectStackInterface
Returns:
boolean value true or false if top contains an integer value equal to the length of the stack -1.

pop

public java.lang.Object pop()
method pop() returns the object placed at the top of the array item[] first the method checks if the stack is empty, if it is then pop has been called incorrectly and it exits the program, else an object temp is created and set equal to the value stored at item indexed at top, and sets item at top to null before decrementing top. then checks if top is equal to item.length divided by 4, then resize the length of the array by 2,

Specified by:
pop in interface ObjectStackInterface
Returns:
object temp to user, assumed user will cast into wanted data type when recieved

push

public void push(java.lang.Object o)
method push() takes in an object o as a parameter, checks if the stack is full by calling isFull(), if it is full the array is resized by calling resize and passing argument 2* the length of the current array. then increments top setting that position in the array to object o.

Specified by:
push in interface ObjectStackInterface
Parameters:
Object - o, type implicit, set as the top'th item in the array item. ,2 * item.length passed to resize as explicit argument

top

public java.lang.Object top()
method top() returns the object stored at the top of the stack, without moving the index or getting rid of the item stored in top.

Specified by:
top in interface ObjectStackInterface
Returns:
item[top] object, does not decrement or increment top.
